abstract: South African prosecutors ask Supreme Court of Appeal to convict Oscar Pistorius of murder for shooting girlfriend Reeva Steenkamp in 2013; cite errors by judge in previous trial, which ended in culpable homicide conviction.
lead_paragraph: South African prosecutors argued that the Olympic runner, who was found guilty of culpable homicide in the killing of his girlfriend, should have been convicted of the more serious crime of murder.

headline.main: Prosecutors in Oscar Pistorius Case Ask Appeals Court for Murder Conviction
headline.print_headline: World Briefing | Africa; South Africa: Appeal in Pistorius Case

snippet: South African prosecutors argued that the Olympic runner, who was found guilty of culpable homicide in the killing of his girlfriend, should have been convicted of the more serious crime of murder.
